item.description:
This walk follows the Mattabessett Trail, one of the many hiking trails in Connecticut maintained by the Connecticut Forest and Park Association.   There is a lookout, poweerline crossings, and a brook.

This will be an easy walk of about 2.5 miles with some rock scrambling.   Social walking pace.   We will be out for one and a half hours or as fate may have it.   I have not visited this place in many years, and I will be following the trail map.   Afterwards we will have a picnic lunch at Seven Falls roadside park.   The walk will be rescheduled if there is a threat of rain.

Dogs and children are welcome as long as they are calm and well behaved.

Location:   [approximate address, no mailbox there, GPS not guaranteed to lead you there] 14 Saybrook Rd, Higganum, CT.

[Link to maps.google.com, www.mapquest.com, or maps.yahoo.com]
